etymology.description: 日(日) (rì, "sun") + 正(正) (zhèng, "correct") = sun as a semantic component with 正 acting as a phonetic guide -> final form meaning "to be, yes, correct"
etymology.interpretation: The character 是 (shì) combines the sun 日(日) (rì, "sun") as a semantic element with 正(正) (zhèng, "correct"), which serves as a phonetic component. This combination resulted in a character that expresses the idea of correctness or truth, hence its meanings related to affirmation and veracity.

examples.chinese: 这本书是我的(這本書是我的)，那本书是他的(那本書是他的)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè běn shū shì wǒ de, nà běn shū shì tā de.
examples.english: This book is mine, and that book is his.

examples.chinese: 这是我的答案(這是我的答案)。
